trans-unit.source: Storing values of one numeric data type in columns of another numeric data type

seg-source.mrk: Storing values of one numeric data type in columns of another numeric data type

target.mrk: Storing values of one numeric data type in columns of another numeric data type

trans-unit.source: An attempt to put a floating-point type of a larger storage size into a location of a smaller size fails only if the value cannot be stored in the smaller-size location. For example:

seg-source.mrk: An attempt to put a floating-point type of a larger storage size into a location of a smaller size fails only if the value cannot be stored in the smaller-size location.

target.mrk: An attempt to put a floating-point type of a larger storage size into a location of a smaller size fails only if the value cannot be stored in the smaller-size location.

trans-unit.source: create table mytable (r REAL, d DOUBLE PRECISION, i INTEGER, de DECIMAL); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted INSERT INTO mytable (r, d) values (3.4028236E38, 3.4028235E38); ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type REAL.

seg-source.mrk: create table mytable (r REAL, d DOUBLE PRECISION, i INTEGER, de DECIMAL); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted INSERT INTO mytable (r, d) values (3.4028236E38, 3.4028235E38); ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type REAL.

target.mrk: create table mytable (r REAL, d DOUBLE PRECISION, i INTEGER, de DECIMAL); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted INSERT INTO mytable (r, d) values (3.4028236E38, 3.4028235E38); ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type REAL.

trans-unit.source: You can store a floating point type in an INTEGER column; the fractional part of the number is truncated. For example:

seg-source.mrk: You can store a floating point type in an INTEGER column; the fractional part of the number is truncated.

target.mrk: You can store a floating point type in an INTEGER column; the fractional part of the number is truncated.

trans-unit.source: INSERT INTO mytable (i) VALUES (1.09e0); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted SELECT i FROM mytable; I --------------- 1

seg-source.mrk: INSERT INTO mytable (i) VALUES (1.09e0); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted SELECT i FROM mytable; I --------------- 1

target.mrk: INSERT INTO mytable (i) VALUES (1.09e0); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted SELECT i FROM mytable; I --------------- 1

trans-unit.source: Integer types can always be placed successfully in approximate numeric values, although with the possible loss of some precision.

seg-source.mrk: Integer types can always be placed successfully in approximate numeric values, although with the possible loss of some precision.

target.mrk: Integer types can always be placed successfully in approximate numeric values, although with the possible loss of some precision.

trans-unit.source: Integers can be stored in decimals if the DECIMAL precision is large enough for the value. For example:

seg-source.mrk: Integers can be stored in decimals if the DECIMAL precision is large enough for the value.

target.mrk: Integers can be stored in decimals if the DECIMAL precision is large enough for the value.

trans-unit.source: INSERT INTO mytable (de) VALUES (55555555556666666666); ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type DECIMAL/NUMERIC(5,2).

seg-source.mrk: INSERT INTO mytable (de) VALUES (55555555556666666666); ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type DECIMAL/NUMERIC(5,2).

target.mrk: INSERT INTO mytable (de) VALUES (55555555556666666666); ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type DECIMAL/NUMERIC(5,2).

trans-unit.source: An attempt to put an integer value of a larger storage size into a location of a smaller size fails if the value cannot be stored in the smaller-size location. For example:

seg-source.mrk: An attempt to put an integer value of a larger storage size into a location of a smaller size fails if the value cannot be stored in the smaller-size location.

target.mrk: An attempt to put an integer value of a larger storage size into a location of a smaller size fails if the value cannot be stored in the smaller-size location.

trans-unit.source: INSERT INTO mytable (i) VALUES 2147483648; ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type INTEGER.

seg-source.mrk: INSERT INTO mytable (i) VALUES 2147483648; ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type INTEGER.

target.mrk: INSERT INTO mytable (i) VALUES 2147483648; ERROR 22003: The resulting value is outside the range for the data type INTEGER.

trans-unit.source: When truncating trailing digits from a NUMERIC value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> rounds down.

seg-source.mrk: When truncating trailing digits from a NUMERIC value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> rounds down.

target.mrk: When truncating trailing digits from a NUMERIC value, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> rounds down.
